author: Staff Reporter
text:
Stating that due to poor condition of the roads ambulance could not enter their village for transporting patients during emergencies, tribals living in Kathakaparaipatty in Thinnanur Nadu in Kolli Hills demanded tar topped road for their hamlets.

In their petition submitted to Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy here, they said that there are 400 households in the village

. But in the absence of tar topped roads, transporting of pregnant women to hospitals during emergencies is a difficult task.

They said that vehicles cannot ply on the pothole ridden mud road and 108 ambulances cannot enter their villages. “Pregnant women have to be carried in cots to reach the main road and from there to the hospital”, they added.

School students find it difficult to use the roads apart from tribals unable to transport their produce to the markets.

“We have to walk for seven km. to reach Semmedu everyday”, they added.

Tribals said that they have been demanding for tar-topped roads for many years now, but no action has been taken so far by the administration.

Economic

conditions

Hence, they wanted the road to be laid so that their transportation can be smooth that would in turn improve their economic conditions.

title: Tribal people demand tar topping of roads in Kolli Hills
